name: Eagle’s brewery
title: This is Eagle's title
subtitle: And this one will be Eagle's subtitle

text.content: Eagle’s brewery

A home brewn taste. Eagle’s brewery started from humble beginnings, a taste crafted for friends and trew beer lovers. After trying the beer at a local tasting we developed a unique design that will surely take this brand to new heights. The solution here was to play to brand’s name, ideas and the feeling of the place it took flight from
Curious? We thought so…

A beer that is made at home, for friends with traditional values needed a logo that reflected those ideas. We’ve chosen a gothic style custom lettering, contrasted with a modern DDC workman’s font. The logo can easly be broken down into a system, from a full lettering to the symbol, suitable for all applications.
Our solution

This design was further taken to its primary application: packaging. We’ve taken Eagle’s name and identity and helped it come alive through an illustration of an Eagle soaring through the skies. In the background there are two mountains present in the region of the brand’s origin.

name: Alfa energy drink
title: This is Alfa title
subtitle: And this one will be Alfa's subtitle

text.content: Alfa energy drink

The client used was just starting out, and as such he didn’t define the brand and the audience in the right way. The initial solution he developed, relied on ‘cannibal marketing’. Taking the elements from brands such as Superman and Red Bull to create something unique.
The problem we faced was that the client wanted his brand to last, to create a new force on the market.
Our solution

Considering this, we had to get started with the logo. It was the most essential part of the whole effort. The original design ‘borrowed’ heavily from Superman’s logo and relied on free fonts to complete the solution, a heavy redesign was needed.
The packaging

This approach was later taken to the packaging as well. Wolf was the main focus with the clearest element being his eye, glaring at the viewer. Elements were added to help bring mystical elements to the design. All of this makes the design really stand out among its competitors, who use far simpler solutions.
The final result? A design that jumps off the shelf.

name: Diary app
title: This is Diary app title
subtitle: And this one will be Diary app subtitle

text.content: Diary app
As human beings, we have just our, unique memories. It's part of us, part of our life, our DNA. Telling a story of your day in 280 characters sometimes can be hard or easy...
Curious? We thought so…
Our solution

Knowing that thoughts or ideas do not have an exact form in our body but they are moving our heartbeat and soul, we tried to materialize them in a form of logo. Dark color symbolizes field in our brain and pinkish shape represents the constant moving of our ideas.
UX solution

Day after day, week after week, formulating your thoughts can be tiresome and monotonous. Our main mission was tapping into the conscience of the user and motivate them to write. The writer can answer and see the development of himself by daily answering questions generated by a cute assistant  - little Birdy, an assistant who suggests a new question every day, creating a perfect ground for writing.
